data.title: Calendar
data.text:
Location: Wolf Trap - Filene Center, 1551 Trap Road Vienna, VA 22182

Date & Time: Friday, May 31 at 8 p.m., Gates open at 6:30 p.m.

Program: View Here

Description: The Marine Band will once again kick off the summer concert season with the annual Summer Blast Off! concert at Wolf Trap with a mix of patriotic favorites, popular movie soundtracks, Sousa marches, and Broadway show tunes, as well as a guest appearance by iconic New Orleans jazz clarinetist Doreen Ketchens. As always, the program will conclude with a medley of the Armed Forces’ service songs honoring all those currently serving, veterans, and their families, followed by one of the best fireworks displays of the year. Don’t miss this annual family event and musical salute to our nation and its heroes!

Fireworks viewing areas will open following the performance at approximately 9:30 p.m. Fireworks to begin at approximately 9:45 p.m.

Due to inclement weather, the June 5th concert has been canceled.

Location: United States Capitol West Terrace

Date & Time: Wednesday, June 5 at 7 p.m.

Program: View Here

Description: Enjoy summertime evenings with outdoor Marine Band concerts at the U.S. Capitol! These hour-long performances are free and open to the public, and feature selections of music that the whole family will love - patriotic marches, traditional wind band repertoire and exciting instrumental solos. Limited seating available - bring a chair or blanket and take part in this fun American tradition!

Weather-related changes to the concert schedule will be announced on the Marine Band website and social media accounts by 6 p.m.

Location: Sylvan Theater on the National Mall (500 feet south of the Washington Monument, near Independence Ave SW and 15th St SW)

Description: Enjoy summertime evenings with outdoor Marine Band concerts at the U.S. Capitol! These hour-long performances are free and open to the public, and feature selections of music that the whole family will love - the Marine Big Band packs a big-sound punch with golden era jazz and swing. Limited seating available - bring a chair or blanket and take part in this fun American tradition!

Weather-related changes to the concert schedule will be announced on the Marine Band website and social media accounts by 6 p.m.

*Due to inclement weather, the Marine Big Band concert scheduled for Thursday, July 25, to be held at the Sylvan Theater on the grounds of the Washington Monument, has been canceled. Please check our schedule for future concerts.*

Description: Enjoy summertime evenings with outdoor Marine Band concerts at the U.S. Capitol! These hour-long performances are free and open to the public, and feature selections of music that the whole family will love - the Marine Latin Jazz Ensemble will take the stage with a hot mix of spicy tunes perfect for swinging on the dance floor. Limited seating available - bring a chair or blanket (and dancing shoes!) and take part in this fun American tradition!

Weather-related changes to the concert schedule will be announced on the Marine Band website and social media accounts by 6 p.m.

Location: Rachel M. Schlesinger Concert Hall and Arts Center, 4915 East Campus Drive, Alexandria, VA 22311

Date & Time: Saturday, August 17 at 7:30 p.m.

Program: View Here

Description: The Marine Chamber Orchestra takes the stage for the performance of a pillar of the chamber music repertoire: Franz Schubert's String Quartet No. 14 in D minor, D. 810, Death and the Maiden. The 40-minute work, which compliments a poem of the same name, modulates into D major only at the end of Death's Song, as the maiden succumbs. Also on the program, contemporary works "Starburst" by Jessie Montgomery and String Quartet No. 2, Company by Philip Glass.
